p: A number of factors can lead to variability in the frequency and severity of arbovirus epidemics, including importation probability [ 6], host susceptibility [ 7], and climatic conditions [ 8]. In particular, temperature is known to be a major driver of spatial and temporal variability in arbovirus transmission, as indicated by empirical studies of relationships between temperature and several epidemiologically important vector and pathogen traits, including mosquito lifespan [ 9â€“ 11], incubation time of the pathogen in the mosquito [ 9, 10, 12], the rate at which mosquitoes engage in blood feeding [ 9, 13], and mosquito density [ 14].
